page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: The survey area divides{physically into 2 parts. In the eastern quarter is the crest of an escarpment at a height of about 180m. The land slopes fairly steeply westwards into the valley of the river Doe Lea where the land is around 70-100m. There are 3 main types of{land use;}agriculture (60%), settlement(25%) and industry (15%). The main{settlement}is in the eastern part of the area centred around Bolsover, with part of the village of Duckmanton in the north western corner of the area. Bolsover has developed around the site of a {castle}which dates from Norman times. The main{industries}are{coal mining and{chemical manufacturing,}both situated in the northern part of the valley. The main road and old railway follow an east/west route across the area.
